com.isoterik.mgdx.m2d.components.physics

Class Collider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.isoterik.mgdx.Component
      • com.isoterik.mgdx.m2d.components.physics.Collider
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BoxCollider, CircleCollider, PolygonCollider

    public abstract class Collider
extends Component
    A collider represents a Shape used for collision detection. Note: collision Shapes are disposed automatically after use.

    • Method Detail

      • setIsSensor

        public void setIsSensor(boolean isSensor)
        Determines if this collider is a sensor. A sensor collider collects contact information but never generates a collision response!
        Parameters:
        isSensor - whether this collider is a sensor.

      • isSensor

        public boolean isSensor()
        Returns:
        whether this collider is a sensor

      • setUserData

        public void setUserData(java.lang.Object userData)
        Sets the user data for the fixture generated by this collider. Note: This method can be called even after the fixture is generated.
        Parameters:
        userData - the user data.

      • getUserData

        public java.lang.Object getUserData()
        Returns the user data for the fixture generated by this collider.
        Returns:
        the user data for the fixture generated by this collider.

      • getGroupIndex

        public short getGroupIndex()
        Returns:
        the collision group index

      • setGroupIndex

        public void setGroupIndex(short groupIndex)
        Sets the collision group index for this collider. Collision groups allow a certain group of objects to never collide (negative) or always collide (positive). Zero means no collision group. Non-zero group filtering always wins against the mask bits.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - the collision group index

      • getCategoryBits

        public short getCategoryBits()
        Returns:
        the collision category bits

      • setCategoryBits

        public void setCategoryBits(short categoryBits)
        Sets the collision category bits. Normally you would just set one bit.
        Parameters:
        categoryBits - the collision category bits

      • getMaskBits

        public short getMaskBits()
        Returns:
        the collision mask bits.

      • setMaskBits

        public void setMaskBits(short maskBits)
        Sets the collision mask bits. This states the categories that this shape would accept for collision.
        Parameters:
        maskBits - the collision mask bits.

      • __setFixture

        public void __setFixture(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Fixture fixture)
        Sets the Fixture generated for this collider. This is called internally by the system and should never be called
        Parameters:
        fixture - the fixture

      • getFixture

        public com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Fixture getFixture()
        Returns:
        the Fixture that this collider generates

      • getShape

        public com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Shape getShape()
        Returns the shape generated by this collider.
        Returns:
        the shape generated by this collider.

      • __disposeShape

        public void __disposeShape()
        Disposes the Shape used by this collider. This is called internally by the system and should never be called

      • getFixtureDef

        public abstract com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.FixtureDef getFixtureDef()
        Creates a FixtureDef for this collider and return it. Concrete subclasses must implement this method
        Returns:
        a FixtureDef for this collider
